gh.asteroids1

Class AsteroidApplet

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Panel
          • java.applet.Applet
            • gh.asteroids1.AsteroidApplet
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.KeyListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Runnable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class AsteroidApplet
extends java.applet.Applet
implements java.lang.Runnable, java.awt.event.KeyListener
    A primitive Applet Asteroids-type game that runs in an applet window 600 x 440. This Applet is designed to be a first step in the teaching of Java applet gaming.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • init

        public void init()
        Initialises the instance variables of the applet.
        Overrides:
        init in class java.applet.Applet

      • drawShip

        public void drawShip()
        Draws the Ship in the coordinate system; sets the position from an affine transform identity 0,0.

      • drawBullets

        public void drawBullets()
        Draws the Bullets in the coordinate system; sets the position from an affine transform identity 0,0. Bullet's with this.isAlive() == false are not drawn.

      • drawAsteroids

        public void drawAsteroids()
        Draws the Asteroids in the coordinate system; sets the position from an affine transform identity 0,0. Asteroid's with this.isAlive() == false are not drawn.

      • update

        public void update(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Updates the game state and prints some info on the game Ship object to the screen.
        Overrides:
        update in class java.awt.Container
        Parameters:
        g - the java.awt.Graphics object that does the drawing

      • updateShip

        public void updateShip()
        Updates the position of the game Ship object; performs a screen position wrap if the ship is moving off the screen.

      • updateBullets

        public void updateBullets()
        Updates the position of the Bullets.

      • updateAsteroids

        public void updateAsteroids()
        Updates the position of the live Asteroids in the game. Performs a screen position wrap if they are moving off the screen, and updates the rotation of the asteroids.

      • checkCollisions

        public void checkCollisions()
        Checks all live game objects for collisions. Bullets and asteroids that have suffered collisions have their alive property set to false. Ship/asteroid collisions reset the ship to the centre of the screen and its velocity to zero.

        public void keyReleased(java.awt.event.KeyEvent k)

        public void keyPressed(java.awt.event.KeyEvent k)
        Handles the key presses that move the ship around the screen and fire the bullets.
        Specified by:
        keyPressed in interface java.awt.event.KeyListener
        Parameters:

      • calcAngleMoveX

        public double calcAngleMoveX(double angle)
        Calculates the movement angle x-component of an on-screen live object. Uses Vx = Vcos(angle)
        Parameters:
        angle - the movement angle
        Returns:
        the x-component of the movement angle

      • calcAngleMoveY

        public double calcAngleMoveY(double angle)
        Calculates the movement angle y-component of an on-screen live object. Uses Vy = Vsin(angle)
        Parameters:
        angle - the movement angle
        Returns:
        the y-component of the movement angle

      • run

        public void run()
        Initialises and runs the game thread.
        Specified by:
